item.title: sf is for birds
item.description: 1 Spatial analysis with R 1 Spatial analysis with R A major powertool in R for spatial analysis and geograpy data processing is the sf package.

item.title: Getting home
item.description: Maps The three rings to rule the world in R and spatial analysis are sf, tigris, and ggplot or leaflet.

item.title: Intro to GIS
item.description: 1 The basics 2 Coordinate Reference Systems 1 The basics GIS stands for ‚Äògeographic information system‚Äô It is a computer system for capturing, storing, checking, and displaying data related to positions on Earth‚Äôs surface.

item.title: Compare years
item.description: Looking for change üìâüìà Looking for change üìâüìà Let‚Äôs compare the observations at a monitoring site for different years. For this example, we will see if we can detect a shift in concentrations after a new highway project was completed.

item.title: GIS and Shapefiles
item.description: The sf package Quick plots Transform coordinates Centroids Area calculations with st_area() Interactive map with leaflet Distance calculations with st_distance() Download Census data American Community Survey (ACS) The sf package The sf (simple features) package can read and save shapefiles, and it plays nicely with the dpylr functions you‚Äôve been learning.

item.title: Help!
item.description: Cheatsheets Use cheatsheets to refresh your memory and find new functions or plots. In RStudio go to Help > Cheatsheets Data Transformation :: Helpful functions for cleaning and arranging your data.

item.title: Install & Update
item.description: Install R and RStudio 1. For state employees 2. For outside folks and friends 3. In the cloud Install R packages Packages used in this training Additional recommended packages Update R packages Install R and RStudio The R language and its tools are built by people from around the world.

item.title: Inventory Duty - Exercise 1

item.title: Porg biomonitoring data
item.description: # load packages library(readr) library(dplyr) library(ggplot2) Start by reading in the Porg data. porg_data <- read_csv("https://itep-r.netlify.com/data/Porg_samples.csv") Take a couple of minutes to get an overview of the data.

item.title: R Camp Primer
item.description: Introduction Installing R and RStudio RStudio tour Creating a project Creating an R script Finding files R syntax Using existing data in R Importing and exporting data Bonus content: plots Introduction This workshop will take you through the basics of navigating RStudio and using R.
